Feature

data.name: [SFDC-406] Add product type dropdown to cancellation cases
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley  

Email Address:
[[leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com]]  

What Kind of Impact is This Having?
New Process or Feature  

What Type of Request is This?
Salesforce  

What Kind of Salesforce Ticket is This?
Feature  

What Type of Page is Associated with This Feature?
Opportunities page and account page  

Are You Requesting a New Field?
Yes  

What is the Function of This New Field?
To report on product types for cancellation cases  

User Story:
As a user, I want to be able to select the product(s) I am requesting to cancel. This will assist with reporting purposes.  

Acceptance Criteria:
Hello,
**** Reference previous ticket [[https://verifiedfirst.atlassian.net/browse/SSCSF-395]] (Marked as Done)***
I need to make amendments to this ticket, and this feature wasn't added when it was moved to partial.
I would like our cancellation cases to include a drop-down menu for agents to categorize what product type (amended from Cancel Type) is being canceled.  

For the cancellations, I would like the following categories below. Please keep in mind there may be more to add as this gets built out. There also needs to be an option to select more than one item to be canceled if applicable. This field needs to be a required field. It should be on the cancellation cases themselves from the "cases" quick links on the account page AND it should be on the opportunity page when selecting a cancellation.  

DROP DOWN MENU PRODUCT TYPES (Amended):  

    Prequal maintenance  
    Renewal Prequal Maintenance  
    IIPP  
    Renewal IIPP  
    Labor law posters  
    Renewal Labor law posters  
    HSE manual  
    Prequal Chapter Maintenance  
    Renewal Prequal Chapter Maintenance  
    MMS  
    Renewal MMS  
    LMS/Safety Connect  
    Renewal LMS/Safety Connect  
    DIY Kits  
    Renewal DIY Kits  
    Safety Meetings  
    Renewal Safety Meetings

What Should We Call This?
Product Type Cancellation Case Feature  

Additional Context:
N/A

data.name: [SFDC-414] Update onboarding task timing
data.notes:
Summary
This task updates Salesforce onboarding automation to create three separate onboarding tasks at staggered intervals (5, 10, and 15 business days) after an opportunity reaches Closed/Won status. This replaces the current single task created at 14 days, aiming to improve client engagement through more frequent touchpoints during the critical onboarding period.

Value or Impact
This enhancement will improve proactive communication with new clients by providing multiple structured touchpoints during onboarding. The phased approach supports higher retention rates and reduces cancellations by ensuring timely follow-ups for delivery expectations and product inquiries. The Client Success team will benefit from a more structured workflow with clearly defined engagement intervals.

Acceptance Criteria
• Three tasks automatically created upon Opportunity Closed/Won:

    "Onboarding 1" due 5 business days after sale date
    "Onboarding 2" due 10 business days after sale date  
    "Onboarding 3" due 15 business days after sale date
    • Previous single 14-day task behavior completely replaced
    • Business-day timing calculation properly implemented
    • Task owner assignment follows existing logic (as validated in Partial)
    • UAT sign-off from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313 required before Production deployment

Technical Details
The implementation involves updating an existing Salesforce Flow to handle multi-task creation with proper timing logic. DML operations create the three tasks at specified business-day offsets. Apex Actions handle task owner assignment based on existing assignment rules. The deployment path follows: Dev (complete) → Partial via Change Set (validated) → Production during next PCM after UAT approval.

Affected Systems
• Salesforce Objects: Opportunity (Closed/Won trigger), Task
• Automation: Onboarding task creation Flow with Apex actions for assignment
• Environments: Dev (complete), Partial (validated and ready for UAT), Production (pending)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes
Development work by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210546655747196 is complete and deployed to Partial environment as of May 28, 2025. Currently awaiting UAT from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313 who confirmed on Oct 15, 2025 that this remains a valid requirement for the Customer Service team. Once UAT sign-off is received, the changes can be deployed to Production in the next PCM window.

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary

Update the existing Salesforce onboarding automation so that, upon Closed/Won, three onboarding tasks are created at staggered intervals: 5, 10, and 15 business days after sale (replacing the current single 14-day task). This sequencing aims to improve client engagement during onboarding for tangible product delivery, expectations, and inquiries.

Value

    Improves proactive communication with new clients, setting clear delivery expectations and answering shipment/product questions.
    Supports higher retention and reduced cancellations by aligning onboarding touchpoints to a phased schedule.
    Enhances Client Success team workflow with timely, staged follow-ups.

Acceptance Criteria

    When an Opportunity is set to Closed/Won, the system creates three Tasks:    -   "Onboarding 1" due 5 business days after the sale date    -   "Onboarding 2" due 10 business days after the sale date        "Onboarding 3" due 15 business days after the sale date

    The prior "single task at 14 days" behavior is replaced by the three-task sequence above.
    
    Business-day timing should be used if supported; correct business-day offsets must be validated in UAT.
    
    Task owner assignment follows the existing assignment logic confirmed in Partial.
    
    UAT sign-off from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313 confirming timing, task creation, and assignment prior to Production deployment.

Technical Requirements

    Salesforce Flow: Existing flow identified and updated to handle multi-task creation and timing logic.
    DML operations to create Tasks at the specified offsets.
    Apex Actions: Used for task owner assignment (as per development notes).
    Deployment path: Changes validated in Dev → deployed and tested in Partial via Change Set; Production deployment targeted during next PCM after UAT approval.
    Note: Ensure business-day calculation approach in Salesforce is consistently applied and testable (e.g., flow logic or Apex-based calculation), and document any platform limitations.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects: Opportunity (Closed/Won trigger), Task
    Automation: Onboarding task creation Flow; Apex actions for assignment
    Environments: Dev, Partial (validated), Production (pending)

Triage Notes

    Background:    -   Requestor: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313 (Customer Service/Client Success).    -   Development status: Flow identified; DML ops and Apex actions added; validated in Dev and Partial (https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210546655747196).        Status: "Ready for UAT"; awaiting Client Success testing/confirmation in Partial before Production PCM.

    Next Steps:    -   Conduct UAT in Partial to validate business-day offsets, three-task creation, and assignment.    -   Capture UAT sign-off from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313.        Schedule Production deployment in the next PCM.

    Context: Still a valid request (confirmed by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605213064313); aligns with broader onboarding improvements.

data.name: [SFDC-422] Implement round-robin CSR case assignment
data.notes:
Summary
Implement automated round-robin assignment for CSR Cases so that new CSR cases are alternately owned by two designated users (Anna Gracia and Lee Guzman). This reduces manual routing and balances workload across the CSR team. Work has been built and tested in DEV and Partial, pending UAT and production deployment.

Value or Impact

    Balances case workload between CSR team members, improving response times.
    Eliminates manual assignment steps, reducing errors and increasing productivity.
    Creates a consistent, auditable assignment process for CSR cases.
    Affects Salesforce Service Cloud operations for Customer Success/CSR workflows.

Acceptance Criteria

    When a CSR Case is submitted/created, Case Owner is automatically assigned in alternating order between:        Anna Gracia
        Lee Guzman

    The assigned owner is immediately visible on the Case record with no manual intervention required.
    Functionality works in Partial/UAT and Production after deployment.
    No new fields are introduced (per intake).

Technical Details

    Salesforce Flow:        Update the Case flow to include round-robin logic.
        Status: Completed in DEV; updated and tested in Partial per progress notes.

    Custom Settings/Custom Metadata:        Store/track last assignee for rotation state.
        Store the list of active assignees (Anna Gracia and Lee Guzman).

    Environments & CI/CD:        DEV: Built and tested.
        Partial: Changes moved/synced; test procedures and deployment components prepared; tested in Partial.
        PROD: Pending UAT sign-off and deployment.

    Access/Permissions:        Ensure validator has access to Partial sandbox for verification.

    Constraints:        “Are you requesting a new field?” = No (from intake).


Affected Systems

    Salesforce Service Cloud: Case object, Case Owner field.
    Salesforce Automation: Case Flow (Record-Triggered Flow or equivalent).
    Salesforce Custom Settings (or Custom Metadata) used for rotation state and configuration.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Pending: Partial sandbox access for validator (https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672) to complete validation.
    Coordinate UAT with https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209323616005465 after validation.
    Upon successful UAT, proceed with production deployment (no new fields required).
    Status context: Marked “Ready for UAT”; awaiting validation and UAT handoff.

data.name: [SFDC-411] Implement NSC Poster Code Automation for SSC Line Items
data.notes:
Summary
Implement NSC poster code fields in Salesforce and automation to populate the correct NSC code based on SSC Line Item name and the State vs. Federal and English vs. Spanish poster product combination. This removes manual entry and enables Fulfillment to run sales and maintenance contract reports that reliably display corresponding NSC poster codes. Requester: Ben Gores (Email: Ben.Gores@safetyservicescompany.com)

Value or Impact

    Eliminates manual state entry and code lookups, reducing fulfillment effort and error risk.
    Improves accuracy and speed of daily/weekly poster sales and maintenance contract reporting.
    Supports fulfillment operations and downstream order processing; currently referenced as a blocker by Fulfillment.

Acceptance Criteria

    Daily/weekly poster sales reports display the correct NSC codes for all relevant poster items.
    Poster maintenance contract reports display the correct NSC codes for all relevant customers.
    NSC poster code fields are reportable and available to add to Fulfillment reports.
    Automation populates the correct NSC code given SSC Line Item name and State/Federal + English/Spanish attributes.
    Mapping reflects the provided NSC product code list as the source of truth.

Technical Details

    Create NSC poster code fields to support:         Poster type: State, Federal (including Federal Contractor where applicable)
        Language variants: English and Spanish

    Implement automation (e.g., Flow, Apex, or formula + helper object) to auto-populate NSC poster codes based on:        SSC Line Item Name
        Poster attributes: State vs. Federal and English vs. Spanish

    Ensure the fields are exposed in Salesforce Reports for:        Daily/weekly poster sales
        Poster maintenance contracts

    Use the attached mapping file as the source of truth:        Attachment: “POSTER AND KIT SKUs.xlsx”
        Relevant sheet(s): “STATE SKU” (includes state + ENG/SPAN SKUs; Federal and Federal Contractor rows also provided)

    Data model references:        Primary: SSC Line Item (by name) and related poster product fields/records where the NSC poster code will reside.

    Implementation considerations:        Determine the storage location for the NSC poster code (custom field on SSC Line Item or related object).
        Validate mapping coverage for Washington variants (Self Insured/Government Issued) and Texas Non-Subscriber.
        Confirm handling for edge cases (e.g., missing state, ambiguous naming, legacy SKUs).


Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects:        SSC Line Item
        Poster product records/fields hosting NSC poster code

    Salesforce Reports (Fulfillment):        Daily/weekly poster sales
        Poster maintenance contracts

    External reference data:        NSC product code mapping from the attachment


Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Current workaround: State values in NSC product codes are replaced with a placeholder, requiring manual entry to complete orders.
    Goal: Upload full NSC product code mappings and tie them to the LLP poster state so codes populate automatically.
    Verify and confirm:        Final field names/locations for NSC poster codes
        All report(s) that require the NSC code fields
        Complete coverage of mapping for English/Spanish and State/Federal combinations

    Stakeholders: Sales / Fulfillment
    Related references: TIE-661; SSCSF-674; SSCIT-661
    Attachment to use for validation and build: “POSTER AND KIT SKUs.xlsx”

Original Description
Summary
Implement NSC poster code fields in Salesforce and automation to populate the correct NSC code based on SSC Line Item name and the State vs. Federal and English vs. Spanish poster product combination. This will enable Fulfillment to run sales and maintenance contract reports that reliably display corresponding NSC poster codes without manual entry.

Requester: Ben Gores (Email: Ben.Gores@safetyservicescompany.com)

Value

    Eliminates manual state entry and code lookups, reducing fulfillment effort and error risk.
    Improves accuracy and speed of daily/weekly poster sales and maintenance contract reporting.
    Supports fulfillment operations and downstream order processing; currently referenced as a blocker.

Acceptance Criteria

    Daily/weekly poster sales reports display correct NSC codes.
    Poster maintenance contract reports display correct NSC codes.

Technical Requirements

    Create NSC poster code fields supporting State and Federal posters and English/Spanish variants.
    Implement automation to auto-populate NSC poster code based on SSC Line Item name and State/Federal + English/Spanish combination.
    Ensure fields are reportable in Salesforce and available in poster sales and maintenance contract reports.
    Use the provided NSC product code list (mapping) as the source of truth.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce data model: SSC Line Item (by name) and related poster product fields/records where NSC poster code will live.
    Salesforce Reports used by Fulfillment:    -   Daily/weekly poster sales        Poster maintenance contracts


Triage Notes

    Current workaround: state values in NSC product codes are replaced with a placeholder, requiring manual entry to complete orders.
    Goal: upload full NSC product code mappings and tie to LLP poster state so codes populate automatically.
    Attachment: “POSTER AND KIT SKUs.xlsx” provides NSC product code mappings.
    Primary stakeholders: Sales / Fulfillment.
    Origination references: “2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request” and tickets SSCSF-674 / SSCIT-661.

Related Resources

    Attachment: POSTER AND KIT SKUs.xlsx
    TIE: TIE-661
    SSCSF-674, SSCIT-661

Original Description

Summary

Implement NSC poster code fields in Salesforce and automation that populates the correct NSC code based on the SSC Line Item name and the combination of State vs. Federal and English vs. Spanish poster products. This enables fulfillment to run sales and maintenance contract reports that reliably display corresponding NSC poster codes without manual entry.

Requester: Ben Gores (Email: Ben.Gores@safetyservicescompany.com)

Value

    Eliminates manual state entry and code lookups, reducing fulfillment effort and error risk.
    Improves accuracy and speed of daily/weekly poster sales and maintenance contract reporting.
    Supports fulfillment operations and downstream order processing, noted as a current blocker in project status.

Acceptance Criteria

    When running a daily report of posters sold the previous day/week, the correct NSC codes populate in that report.
    When running a report listing customers with current poster maintenance contracts, the correct NSC codes populate in that report.

Technical Requirements

    Create NSC poster code fields that support both State and Federal posters and both English and Spanish variants.
    Implement automation so the NSC poster code auto-populates based on logic tied to the SSC Line Item name and the product’s State/Federal + English/Spanish combination.
    Ensure the fields are available for Salesforce reporting and can be included in poster sales and maintenance contract reports.
    Use the provided NSC product code list (mapping) as the source of truth for the automation logic.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce data model: SSC Line Item (by name) and related poster product fields/records where NSC poster code will live.
    Salesforce Reports used by Fulfillment for:    -   Daily/weekly poster sales    -   Poster maintenance contracts

Triage Notes

    Current workaround (per requester): state values in NSC product codes are replaced with a placeholder, requiring manual entry to complete orders.
    Goal: upload the full NSC product code mappings and tie them to the LLP poster state so that codes populate automatically.
    Attachment: “Attached is the list of NSC product codes.” If the attachment is not visible or accessible, please re-attach the mapping file to validate and configure automation.
    Primary stakeholders: Sales / Fulfillment.
    Original intake info references: “2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request” link and originating ticket indicators (SSCSF-674 / SSCIT-661).

data.name: [SFDC-423] Update Cancel Case Forms with Free-Form Description
data.notes:
Name:
Leslie Onley  

Email Address:
[[leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:leslie.onley@safetyservicescompany.com]]  

Department Represented:
Customer Service  

Impact:
Inconvenience  

Type of Request:
Salesforce  

Salesforce Ticket Type:
Bug  

Expected Result:
The description field should be freeform.  

Current Issue:
The description field is a dropdown.  

User Story:
As a user, I want to have a free text field to add notes to the cancel cases. Additionally, I realized that we have two different forms depending on where you submit the cancel from, i.e., submitting a cancel from an opportunity vs. submitting a cancel from the cases page. These forms should be identical, if possible, no matter where the cancellation is submitted from.  

Cancel Case Examples:  

    Cancel case with description (How we want it to work):
    [[https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Case/500Ub00000LotlBIAR/view]]  
    
    Cancel case without description and only a dropdown menu:
    [[https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Case/500Ub00000OQWrGIAX/view]]

Acceptance Criteria:
When submitting a cancel case, a free text description field should also be included on the form.  

Task Title:
Cancel Cases Description Update  

Additional Context:
When submitting a cancel from an opportunity (screenshot below), this form should have the option to input description notes in freeform text. When submitting a cancel from the cases page (screenshot below), this form should mirror the opportunity cancel case form.  

----------------------------------------

This task was submitted through 2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request
[[https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429]]  

Created from Asana: [[SSCSF-686] Cancel Cases Description Update | https://app.asana.com/0/0/1209829719011771/f]

*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Inconvenience
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*Description:*
Auto Assign Finance Case Record Types to Finance Queue
*Additional Context:*
We would like automation built to automatically assign all cases with Case Record Type = Finance to Case Owner = Finance Queue. 
Currently, cases auto-assign to whoever created the case. We are finding individuals are forgetting to reassign these cases to Finance Queue. This automation would be a time-saving convenience for those that submit cases to Finance.
Included snip of Finance Case showing Owner = Finance Queue
*Resolution:*
When a Finance case is submitted, Case Owner will automatically be assigned to the Finance Queue
———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-419] Restore discount field to Edit Selected Quote Line Items interface
data.notes:
*Name:*
Matt Gascon
*Email address:*
[[matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:[matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com]]|mailto:[[matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com]|mailto:[matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com|mailto:matt.gascon@safetyservicescompany.com]]]
*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Broken (Revenue Impacting)
*What type of request is this?:*
Software Issue or Bug
*Software Name & Version:*
Salesforce 
*Steps to Reproduce:*
When adding line items to quotes, the discount field is missing, you now have to save the line items and edit each one individually, adding several unnecessary steps to building a quote. This looks like it is a result of the changes from SSCSF-638 and SSCSF - 647, where finance asked to have discounting changed from percentage to a dollar amount. 
*Expected vs Actual Behavior:*
Expected - there is a field to enter a discount when adding products to the quote in "Edit Selected Line Quote Line Items" grid. Actual - it is no longer visible, requiring the sales agent to edit each line item one at a time. 
*What should we call this?:*
ATTENTION - Add Discount filed back to the "Edit Selected Quote Line Items" Field
*Additional Context:*
This change adds a ton of extra steps for sales agents creating quotes, please add the field ASAP.
———————————————
This task was submitted through *2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request*
[[https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429]]
Created from Asana: [[SSCSF-682] [SSCIT-670] ATTENTION - Add Discount filed back to the "Edit Selected Quote Line Items" Field|https://app.asana.com/0/0/1209800168234409/f]

data.name: [SFDC-393] Coordinate Daily Standup Action Items
data.notes:
SSCSF Daily Standup

Date: Wed Mar 12 2025 10:30:00 GMT-0400 (Eastern Daylight Time)

Participants:

    dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com
    sjadhav@verifiedfirst.com
    nsingh@verifiedfirst.com
    rteagarden@verifiedfirst.com
    sitara.jadhav@safetyservicescompany.com
    justin.bilodeau@safetyservicescompany.onmicrosoft.com

Transcript: https://app.fireflies.ai/view/SSCSF-Daily-Standup::01JNNZCQWFNQ0F1MW8FNWZQD2T

Audio: https://app.fireflies.ai/view/SSCSF-Daily-Standup::01JNNZCQWFNQ0F1MW8FNWZQD2T

Duration: 20 minutes

----------------------------------------

Overview

In the SSCSF Daily Standup meeting, the team discussed several key updates and action items:

    Sitara is awaiting Matt's confirmation regarding the Televerde integration approach.
    Dan will reach out to Matt for an update on the documentation shared earlier.
    Progress is not hindered as they await feedback from Televerde.
    Sitara addressed PCM stories and identified an issue with two similar fields, suggesting a merger into 'LLP Poster State' for simplicity. Dan is tasked to add comments to the corresponding ticket.
    Sitara completed the changes to chatter notifications and is now waiting for a testing email. Dan will provide a system email for notifications.
    Dan will schedule onboarding sessions with Cassie, ensuring Sitara is available to explain the invoicing portal.
    Dan aims to maintain better time management during meetings.

Action items were assigned to both Dan and Sitara to facilitate these updates and support Cassie's onboarding process.

----------------------------------------

Meeting Type

Daily Standup

----------------------------------------

Action Items

Dan DeZago
    Email Matt for an update on the Televerde integration document (03:50)
    Add detailed comments to ticket SSCSF-603 regarding the Poster State field issue (09:55)
    Provide a system email address for chatter notifications (15:35)
    Schedule 30-minute sessions with Cassie for Monday and Tuesday (18:33)
    Send Cassie an email to schedule time with Sitara at 8 o'clock next Monday and Tuesday (19:08)

Sitara Jadhav
    Test chatter changes once the email is received (13:30)
    Move chatter changes to the partial environment after testing (13:51)
    Be available to explain the invoicing portal to Cassie next week (18:21)

----------------------------------------

Shorthand Bullet Points

:wrench: Televerde Integration Update (00:02 - 05:35)
    Sitara is waiting for Matt's confirmation on the implementation approach.
    Dan will email Matt for an update on the document shared on the 5th.
    The team is waiting on Televerde's feedback, which is not blocking progress.

:bar_chart: PCM Stories and Discount Field (05:35 - 09:55)
    Sitara worked on PCM stories and the discount field.
    An issue was uncovered with two similar fields: Poster State and LLP Poster.
    A proposal was made to merge the fields into 'LLP Poster State' for simplicity.

data.name: [SFDC-338] Daily Standup Meeting Documentation
data.notes:
Title: SSCSF Daily Standup
Date: Thu Mar 06 2025 10:00:00 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)
Participants: sjadhav@verifiedfirst.com (mailto:sjadhav@verifiedfirst.com), nsingh@verifiedfirst.com (mailto:nsingh@verifiedfirst.com), heather.curless@safetyservicescompany.com (mailto:heather.curless@safetyservicescompany.com), justin.bilodeau@safetyservicescompany.onmicrosoft.com (mailto:justin.bilodeau@safetyservicescompany.onmicrosoft.com), rteagarden@verifiedfirst.com (mailto:rteagarden@verifiedfirst.com), lwhetter@verifiedfirst.com (mailto:lwhetter@verifiedfirst.com), sitara.jadhav@safetyservicescompany.com (mailto:sitara.jadhav@safetyservicescompany.com), dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com (mailto:dan.dezago@safetyservicescompany.com)
Transcript: See full transcript (https://app.fireflies.ai/view/SSCSF-Daily-Standup::01JN428TYKHPAW6MHEN7ER8EDM)
Audio: Listen to audio (https://app.fireflies.ai/view/SSCSF-Daily-Standup::01JN428TYKHPAW6MHEN7ER8EDM)
Duration: 16

Overview
 The SSCSF Daily Standup meeting focused on project updates, access issues, and governance considerations. Ron initiated a discussion seeking a high-level plan from Dan for the earnings project while addressing some challenges, including Dan's inability to transfer tickets from the SSCIT board to Salesforce. Laura requested finance leadership profile access for Mike, and Nisha confirmed her ability to move stories to the SSC board. The team discussed the establishment of access for Mike and automation for Salesforce request assignments, with Dan temporarily handling both Technical Management and Product Owner approvals in light of governance principles, especially in preparation for the upcoming SOC 2 audit. Action items were assigned to Dan, Ron, Nisha, and Sitara, ensuring a clear path forward in managing the backlog and operational compliance.


Meeting Type
 Daily Standup and Project Update Meeting


Action Items
 Dan DeZago

 Provide high-level plan for earnings project to Ron (01:23)

 Move Laura's invoicing tasks to Salesforce backlog (02:16)

 Set up automation for Salesforce request assignments (08:34)

 Send list of tickets to Nisha for moving (16:04)

 Handle both Technical Management and Product Owner approvals for PCM202 (11:38)

 Ron

 Enable Dan's access to move tickets to Salesforce (02:16)

 Nisha

 Move stories from SSCIT board to Salesforce board (05:27)

 Assign herself to the Mike access ticket (08:26)

 Sitara Jadhav

 Keep an eye out for new tickets hitting the backlog (04:21)


Shorthand Bullet
 :arrows_counterclockwise: Project Updates and Access Issues (00:25 - 08:28)

 Ron requests high-level plan from Dan for earnings project

 Dan working on depreciation of Scion and tailgate situation

 Dan unable to move tickets from SSCIT board to Salesforce

 Laura requests finance leadership profile access for Mike (Tashari email sysadmin1)

 Nisha has access to move stories to SSC board

 Dan to provide ticket numbers for Laura's invoicing tasks

 :key: Access and P

data.name: [SFDC-345] Create Sales Tax Field for Invoice Line Items
data.notes:
Name: 
Laura Whetter

Email Address: 
lwhetter@verifiedfirst.com

Impact: 
Full Stoppage (Revenue Impacting)

Request Type: 
Salesforce

Description: 
Blocker for Salesforce Invoicing - Sales Tax Line Item Field

Additional Context: 
A Sales Tax field needs to be created on the:

    Invoice object
    Record type: Archived_Penguin Invoice
    Line Item Details 
        Sales Tax (FIELD TO BE ADDED)

This field needs to be entered as a static dollar amount (not a percentage).

Resolution: 
A field for sales tax exists at the line item level where the dollar amount can be entered as a static amount (e.g., $10.41).

data.name: [SFDC-350] Create Custom Report for Applied Transactions
data.notes:
*Name:*
Laura Whetter
*Email address:*
*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Broken (Revenue Impacting)
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*Description:*
Custom report showing all Applied Transaction
*Additional Context:*
Can we have a custom report built to show all Applied Transactions? 
We currently have Applied Transaction History (this feels more like an audit trail, but does not easily list out all existing applied transactions.)
The other report with have is Applied Transactions with Invoices, but this does not capture Applied Transactions that are not tied to an invoice object. As there are Applied Transactions tied to payments and account credits we need reporting visibility on.
*Resolution:*
Ability to run a report to see all Applied Transactions regardless of the object they are tied to.
———————————————
This task was submitted through *2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request*

data.notes:
User Story:
As a CSM User, I would like to be able to indicate when a specific contact for an account has been non-responsive to attempts to contact them

Acceptance Criteria:
Add checkbox to contact object labeled ‘non-responsive’
Checkbox should not be tied to any automation and just have edit access to check or uncheck
Checkbox should be added to the Contacts section under quick links on the account object

Page Layout:

data.name: [SFDC-408] Add Notes Field to Cancellation Cases
data.notes:
*Name:*
Lucino Canete
*Email address:*
[[lcanete@verifiedfirst.com|mailto:[lcanete@verifiedfirst.com|mailto:lcanete@verifiedfirst.com]]|mailto:[[lcanete@verifiedfirst.com|mailto:lcanete@verifiedfirst.com]|mailto:[lcanete@verifiedfirst.com|mailto:lcanete@verifiedfirst.com]]]
*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Inconvenience
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*What kind of Salesforce Ticket is this?:*
Feature
*What type of page is associated with this feature?:*
Cancellation Case 
*Are you requesting a new field?:*
Yes
*What is the function of this new field?:*
Notes
*User Story:*
When creating a case directly from the opportunity, it is a lot better that we have the option to put all necessary information on that cancellation case so that the team that will be working on it won't miss anything. 
*Acceptance Criteria:*
It will avoid a lot of back and forth from Finance and CS to get more context when we can add it directly from the case. 
*What should we call this?:*
Option to add notes/case context
*Additional Context:*
I worked with Anna from CS who's handling most of our cancellation cases. When I created one case today, it seems that the option to add description or more context of what the case was, is gone. That said, when Anna works on them, she need to get back to Finance to get more information. We we are only given these Cancel Category drop down choices; Out of business, No longer need service, Cannot reach, Client did not agree to service, Price concession. No option to add notes.
To save time for all of us, please add the option to add description/context or notes section - whatever you wanna call it so that CS gets everything the need to quickly resolve the case. 
The screenshots attached are the only info required to submit a cancellation case. 
———————————————
This task was submitted through *2025 IT & Engineering Ticket Request*
[[https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429]]
Created from Asana: [[SSCSF-671] Option to add notes/case context|https://app.asana.com/0/0/1209758056206355/f]

*What kind of Impact is this having?:*
Full Stoppage (Revenue Impacting)
*What type of request is this?:*
Salesforce
*Description:*
Stripe Portal Pay Now Link
*Additional Context:*
Will the pay now link to the customer payment portal be included as a hyperlink on invoices generated as a PDF from Salesforce? 
See snip for example of Verified First invoice with link embedded into PDF generated invoice.
This link would be the new payment option A under the notes section of the current PDF invoice (see snip). Option B would then be what is currently Option A (By Phone), and Option C would be what is currently option B (By Mail).
*Resolution:*
Hyperlink added to PDF invoice generated from SF that link customers to the payment portal and autofilled the Account and Authentication Code credentials

Salesforce

Bug

none

data.name: [SFDC-331] Update Account Status Automation Timing Pre-Renewal Rest
data.notes:
We need the account status for accounts to update to Pre-Renewal Rest' 1 calendar month before they enter the renewal window (5 months before expiration), currently it updates this status based on the DAY of expiration, this needs to be changed to MONTH

User Story: As a Salesforce user, I would like the Account Status for any account that has a not renewed contract expiring in 5 months to update to ‘Pre Renewal Rest’

Acceptance Criteria:
If account has a contract with renewal status unknown and contract expiration date enters the MONTH that equals 5 months from expiration, account status should update to ‘Pre-Renewal Rest’

If Renewal Status does not equal Unknown, Account Status will not be updated to ‘Pre Renewal Rest’

Once contract expiration date is within 4 months of expiration Account Status will continue to update to Renewal as it is now

Same as user story
